implementations.type_class:
class Monad m where
  return :: a -> m a
  (>>=)  :: m a -> (a -> m b) -> m b
implementations.do_notation:
do
  x <- action1
  y <- action2 x
  return (x + y)
-- Desugars to: action1 >>= \x -> action2 x >>= \y -> return (x + y)
examples: do { line <- getLine; putStrLn line }  -- IO monad

implementations.pattern: Types with map and flatMap are monadic
implementations.desugaring:
for { x <- m; y <- f(x) } yield g(x,y)
// Becomes: m.flatMap(x => f(x).map(y => g(x,y)))
examples: for { x <- Some(5) } yield x * 2  // Some(10)

  user = await get_user(id)  # await is like do-notation
  orders = await get_orders(user)
  return orders
